author: Grace Benninghoff
title: 'Relentless' effort needed to get Maine ready for extreme weather, commission says
text:
A group paddles a canoe around a flooded Custom House Wharf at high tide in Portland on Jan. 13, 2024. Ben McCanna/Portland Press Herald
The Maine commission created in the wake of damaging storms has released its final report on how to prepare the state for extreme weather events.
The 24-member Infrastructure Rebuilding and Resilience Commission was established by Gov. Janet Mills in May 2024 after several extreme storms rocked the state in late 2023, wiping out infrastructure and flooding roadways . The commission aimed to create a long-term resiliency plan for the state as extreme storms become more common due to climate change.
“Without relentless focus and attention, Maine risks losing the meaningful momentum it’s gained since the devastating storms of December 2023 and January 2024, which prompted the creation of our Commission,” the report said.
The commission’s plan has three core pillars: strengthening infrastructure and reducing disaster risk, improving disaster preparedness and response, and sustaining the state’s resilience momentum. Some of the group’s recommendations are already under way, including the establishment of the State Resilience Office, which will fund programs to strengthen homes, improve flood readiness, and support emergency response and communication systems around the state.
View this document on Scribd The plan calls for that office to track and report the progress as the state works toward improved disaster resilience.
The report by the commission highlighted the increased risk for natural disasters in Maine. Between March 2022 and May 2024, the report said, Maine experienced nine natural disasters.
“The rising severity and frequency of these storms and floods raise urgent alarms about the increasing risks of extreme weather in our state and drive home the imperative that Maine plan for and invest in infrastructure resilience at the state, regional and local levels,” the report said.
Last week, the Mills administration announced $8 million in grant funding through the state’s Community Resilience Partnership to help communities protect people, businesses, and infrastructure from flooding, storm surge and other climate effects. The report emphasized the importance of harnessing the resources available to make Maine safer in the wake of storms.
“In Maine, we no longer know the storms of yesterday. Storms are now more frequent and dangerous, flooding our homes and businesses, washing out our roads and bridges, and threatening the health of our people and economy,” Mills said in a prepared statement. “The changes to our weather and our climate are harming people, communities, and businesses across our state.
Related Read our complete coverage of the December 2023 storm “We must prevent as much damage as possible and be ready to quickly recover when storms take their toll. … This plan will guide efforts in the year to come to protect this great state we all call home.”
A statement from Mills’ office said the increasing uncertainty about federal disaster funding highlights the importance of the state’s efforts to address climate change.
“As the commission completed its work, the federal government proposed eliminating (the Federal Emergency Management Agency) and sunsetting critical funding programs such as the Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities (BRIC) program,” the statement said. “These developments underscore the importance of state-level leadership and investment in resilience.”

author: newsdirectory3
title: Access Denied
text:
Polar Plunge: ‌Arctic ⁢Blast Sends Temperatures Plummeting ‌Across the U.S. Millions Brace for Frigid⁣ Conditions as Winter Weather Advisory Issued
A blast of Arctic air has ⁣descended upon the United States, sending temperatures plummeting and prompting winter weather advisories across a wide swathe of the country. From the Midwest to the ‌East​ Coast,residents are bundling up against the bitter cold,with some areas experiencing their coldest temperatures in years.
The National Weather Service has issued warnings for dangerously low wind chills, with temperatures feeling⁤ as low as -30 degrees⁤ Fahrenheit in⁢ some regions. Experts are urging residents to take precautions against frostbite and hypothermia ,advising them⁣ to limit time outdoors and dress in layers.
“This is a serious cold snap,” said Dr.Emily carter, a meteorologist with⁢ the National Weather​ Service.”People need to⁤ be prepared and take steps to protect themselves from the extreme cold.”
The frigid temperatures are expected to persist for several days, with a gradual warming trend anticipated by the weekend. ⁣In the meantime, schools ⁣and businesses are facing closures and delays, and travel disruptions are being reported across the ⁣affected⁣ areas.
As the nation shivers through this arctic blast, communities are coming together to support those most vulnerable ‌to the cold. Shelters are ⁣opening their doors to provide warmth and refuge, and volunteers are distributing​ blankets and warm clothing to those in ​need.
Battling the Bite: expert Offers​ Advice on Navigating the Arctic Blast NewsDirect3.com – As an arctic air mass descends upon‌ the nation,‌ plunging temperatures to record lows, NewsDirect3.com spoke wiht Dr. Emily⁣ Carter,a meteorologist​ with⁤ the National weather ‌Service,to ⁤gain ‌insight on⁣ how to⁢ weather this frigid storm.
NewsDirect3.com: Dr.Carter, the nation is experiencing what you’ve ⁣called a “serious cold snap.” ‍Could⁣ you ⁣elaborate on the severity of this weather event?
Dr. Carter: absolutely.‌ This isn’t ⁤just a typical winter chill. This arctic blast ​is bringing​ ⁣ dangerously low wind chills, with some regions experiencing temperatures that feel as low as -30 degrees fahrenheit. This prolonged exposure can lead to frostbite‍ and hypothermia⁣ within minutes.
NewsDirect3.com: These temperatures are alarming. What advice ​ do you have for our readers ‍to stay safe ‍during this frigid ‌period?
Dr. Carter: The most important thing is to limit your time outdoors. If ​you must go out, dress in​ layers, covering ⁢all exposed skin. Hats, scarves, and gloves are essential. Be mindful ⁣of signs of frostbite, such as numbness or a white, waxy appearance‍ on the skin. Seek medical attention instantly if you⁣ suspect frostbite or hypothermia.
NewsDirect3.com: ⁢ For those ‌who are more vulnerable, like the elderly or ⁣those experiencing ⁣homelessness, what additional precautions should be taken?
Dr. Carter: It’s⁣ crucial for vulnerable populations to seek warm shelter. Community ‍centers, libraries, and shelters ‍are often open during extreme weather​ events. Check on neighbors and loved ones who may⁣ need assistance.
NewsDirect3.com: When can we expect a break from these extreme temperatures?
Dr.carter: while this arctic blast is expected to persist for several days,‌ we anticipate ‌a gradual warming trend beginning by the ‌weekend.
NewsDirect3.com: Dr. Carter, thank you for sharing your expertise during this challenging⁤ weather ‌event. ⁢Your advice is incredibly valuable for our readers.

author: David Hookstead
title: Declassified CIA Document Features Terrifying Claims About Mars | OutKick
text: A declassified document about Mars might send a chill down your spine. UFOs and aliens are a popular subject here at OutKick. People can't get enough of the unexplainable, and I don't blame them. The amount of video footage we have of objects in the sky that have no explanation is definitely concerning. Well, I suggest you buckle up because there's more troubling content to ponder. Declassified CIA document about Mars is terrifying. A declassified CIA document shows an interview conducted with someone in 1984 who allegedly used astral projection in the past, according to Unilad. Astral projection is described as, \"an intentional OBE that usually involves the experience that the self can seem to travel far from their body — even to other countries or planets.\" Buckle up because the CIA apparently using out-of-body experiences to explore what Mars was like over a million years ago isn't even the craziest part. It's what the document shows that is bone-chilling. The subject being interviewed by the CIA claims to have seen a \"dying\" race of creatures described as incredibly tall, \"thin\" and \"ancient.\" \"They're dying, it's past their time or age,\" the subject told the CIA member conducting the interview. You can read the specific page from the report below. There are so many things about this situation that I don't even know where to begin. First, why was the CIA using astral projection to explore Mars in the past? Am I crazy or is that an egregious waste of time and resources? It's either that or the CIA knows something the rest of us don't. If that's the case, then it's time for a very terrifying conversation about the reality we're living in. Furthermore, the subject being interviewed *ALLEGEDLY* witnessed a dying race of \"ancient\" people in structures on Mars. If that's not absolutely terrifying, then I don't know what is. The page from the document shown above could be out of a horror movie. Scary tall and skinny individuals trying to survive on Mars as they face extinction? Yeah, that's the definition of nightmare fuel, my friends. Of course, there's also the very real possibility (and the most likely) that this interview from 1984 is complete BS and the guy was making it up as we went. Let's hope that's the case, because I want to live in a universe where humans are the only ones running the show. I don't need to lose sleep over Mars potentially having an ancient race of aliens. Let me know at David.Hookstead@outkick.com.

author: HispanTV
title: Fuerzas yemeníes atacan dos barcos vinculados al régimen de Israel | HISPANTV
text:
Las Fuerzas Armadas de Yemen informan que llevaron a cabo dos operaciones militares en el mar Rojo y el gofo de Adén contra dos buques afiliados a Israel.
A través de un comunicado emitido este jueves, el portavoz de las Fuerzas Armadas de Yemen, el teniente general Yahya Sari, ha detallado que la primera operación militar apuntó al buque petrolero SOUNION, vinculado a una empresa que trata con el régimen sionista, mientras navegaba por el golfo de Adén.
El vocero castrense ha agregado que, en la segunda operación, los combatientes yemeníes lanzaron un ataque que alcanzó de forma precisa y directa al barco israelí Sw North Wind I en el mar Rojo y corre riesgo de hundirse.
En ambos casos, explica el general Sari, las embarcaciones fueron atacadas por violar la prohibición yemení de navegar por aguas bajo dominio de Yemen rumbo a los puertos israelíes de la Palestina ocupada.
Fuerzas Armadas de Yemen derriban dron estadounidense MQ-9 Asimismo, ha señalado que las dos operaciones se realizaron utilizando varias embarcaciones no tripuladas, misiles balísticos y alados y drones.
TRADUCTION: Les forces armées yéménites annoncent le ciblage de deux navires en mer Rouge et dans le golfe d'Aden : 1La première opération a visé le navire pétrolier SOUNION. Le navire a été gravement endommagé et risque de couler, grâce à Dieu. 2L'autre opération a visé le 1/2 https://t.co/UnwCn5xedu
— Monique Beauchamp (@moniqueb54) August 22, 2024 En la misma jornada, el líder del movimiento popular Ansarolá, Seyed Abdulmalik Badreddin al-Houthi, ha informado que Yemen ha realizado 21 operaciones militares en la última semana utilizando misiles balísticos y de crucero, drones y embarcaciones marítimas contra los objetivos israelíes y de sus aliados.
Ansarolá a Israel: lo que les espera es más fuerte que ataque a Tel Aviv Desde noviembre pasado, Yemen ejecuta operaciones militares contra objetivos israelíes en los territorios palestinos ocupados y contra barcos israelíes o vinculados al régimen que navegan en el mar Rojo, el océano Índico y el estrecho de Bab el-Mandeb y aguas adyacentes.
Estas operaciones se realizan en apoyo al pueblo palestino y sus combatientes y en respuesta a la guerra genocida del régimen sionista en la Franja de Gaza, que ha dejado más de 40 250 muertos desde el 7 de octubre.
Ataque de Yemen demuestra vulnerabilidad defensiva de Israel msr/ncl/hnb

author: @infoitestero
title: Ucraina Accusata di Attacco alla Centrale Nucleare di Kursk
text: [ ](/a/1C8B020F-11C9-4624-B8B1-D398E1CBBF01/Mosca-Kiev-minaccia-la-centrale-di-Kursk-L-Aiea-va-in-missione) [Leggi](https://ilmanifesto.it/mosca-kiev-minaccia-la-centrale-di-kursk-laiea-va-in-missione) Il presidente russo Vladimir Putin ha accusato l'Ucraina di aver tentato di colpire la centrale nucleare di Kursk. La denuncia è stata fatta durante una riunione in videoconferenza convocata per fare il punto sulla situazione nelle regioni di Kursk, Bryansk e Belgorod, che dal 6 agosto sono sotto attacco delle forze di Kiev. La regione di Kursk è da oltre due settimane oggetto di una grande offensiva da parte delle forze ucraine. Il capo dell'intelligence di Kiev, Kyrylo Budanov, ha confermato la "firma ucraina" dietro l'attacco su larga scala con droni di due giorni fa, che ha raggiunto anche Mosca. Secondo Budanov, sono stati colpiti basi militari e centri per l'intercettazione di dati. Il direttore generale dell'Agenzia Internazionale per l'Energia Atomica (AIEA) ha annunciato che visiterà la centrale nucleare di Kursk la settimana prossima. La visita è attesa con grande interesse, dato il contesto di intensificazione dei combattimenti nella regione. Nel frattempo, il presidente ucraino Volodymyr Zelensky si è recato nella regione di Sumy, al confine con la Russia, per incontrare il comandante in capo delle forze armate, Oleksandr Syrsky. Zelensky ha sottolineato l'importanza dell'operazione in corso a Kursk, definendola un modo sistemico di difendere l'Ucraina e porre fine alla guerra alle condizioni di un'Ucraina indipendente. Le accuse di Putin e la risposta di Zelensky evidenziano la complessità e la gravità della situazione attuale. La visita dell'AIEA potrebbe fornire ulteriori chiarimenti sulla sicurezza della centrale nucleare di Kursk e sulle reali intenzioni delle forze ucraine.

California decreta el estado de emergencia por la gripe aviar tras la confirmación de un paciente grave en Luisiana
por
Barney_77
a
elpais.com
enviado:
____
El gobernador de California, Gavin Newsom, ha decretado este miércoles el estado de emergencia después de que se confirmara el caso grave de gripe aviar en un paciente ingresado en un hospital de Luisiana. Es el primer caso con síntomas graves detectado en el país. El Departamento de Agricultura federal estima que en California, el Estado más poblado del país, hay unas 645 cabezas de ganado infectadas con el virus H5N1, detectado desde agosto pasado. La presencia de la bacteria se puede rastrear al mes de marzo.
|

author: Edwin Caicedo
title: Ocho ciudades de Latinoamérica se preparan para ‘rugir’ con una campaña que busca impulsar la protección de los jaguares
text: Noticia Medio Ambiente Ocho ciudades de Latinoamérica se preparan para ‘rugir’ con una campaña que busca impulsar la protección de los jaguares La campaña ‘Latinoamérica ruge por el jaguar’ es una iniciativa para promover la conciencia sobre la protección de este animal y sus corredores genéticos que atraviesan el continente. Conforme a los criterios de Temas Relacionados [ ‘Desarrollamos el primer bono de biodiversidad y gracias a eso ofrecemos créditos con tasas preferenciales a proyectos que ayuden a conservar’: BBVA Colombia](https://www.eltiempo.com/vida/medio-ambiente/creamos-el-primer-bono-de-biodiversidad-y-gracias-a-eso-podemos-ofrecer-creditos-con-tasas-preferenciales-a-proyectos-que-ayuden-a-conservar-bbva-colombia-3363514) La importancia del jaguar DESCARGA LA APP EL TIEMPO Personaliza, descubre e informate. Empodera tu conocimiento [Internet para hogares se podría convertir en un servicio público domiciliario vigilado por la Superservicios](/economia/sectores/internet-para-hogares-se-podria-convertir-en-un-servicio-publico-vigilado-por-la-superservicios-3361719) [Así tendría que ser el contrato de una empleada doméstica en Colombia con la reforma laboral](/economia/finanzas-personales/asi-tendria-que-ser-el-contrato-de-una-empleada-domestica-en-colombia-con-la-reforma-laboral-3364497) [¿Fue uno de los afortunados ganadores? Conozca los números y resultados del sorteo del 20 de julio de Baloto y Baloto Revancha](/economia/finanzas-personales/fue-uno-de-los-afortunados-ganadores-conozca-los-numeros-y-resultados-del-sorteo-del-20-de-julio-de-baloto-y-baloto-revancha-3364205) [¿Le atinó al premio mayor? Aquí están los resultados y ganadores del sorteo del 20 de julio de la Lotería del Cauca y Boyacá](/economia/finanzas-personales/le-atino-al-premio-mayor-aqui-estan-los-resultados-y-ganadores-del-sorteo-del-20-de-julio-de-la-loteria-del-cauca-y-boyaca-3364203) Más noticias Nuestro mundo [ Líder indígena en Nariño lanzó alerta en España sobre el riesgo que corre la laguna de La Cocha ](/colombia/otras-ciudades/lider-indigena-en-narino-lanzo-alertaen-espana-sobre-el-riesgo-que-corre-la-laguna-de-la-cocha-3364729) Asegura que este ecosistema se encuentra en un riesgo ambiental. [ Paro de taxistas: puntos de concentración en Cali, Cartagena, Santa Marta, Pasto y otras ciudades de Colombia que se unieron ](/colombia/otras-ciudades/cali-cartagena-santa-marta-pasto-y-todas-las-ciudades-que-se-unen-al-paro-de-taxistas-este-martes-estos-son-los-puntos-de-concentracion-3364722) Los taxistas se movilizarán este 23 de julio en contra de los conductores de particulares que trabajan a través de plataformas. [ Atención: estos son los 7 puntos de concentración de los taxistas en Cartagena que se suman al paro nacional ](/colombia/otras-ciudades/taxistas-en-cartagena-que-se-suman-a-paro-nacional-estos-son-los-7-puntos-de-concentracion-3364713) [ Impactante video: motociclista salió disparado al ser embestido por un carro en Tunja; buscan al conductor que huyó ](/colombia/otras-ciudades/impactante-video-motociclista-salio-disparado-al-ser-embestido-por-un-carro-en-tunja-buscan-al-conductor-que-huyo-3364709) [ ¿Le conviene a Medellín la venta de las acciones que EPM tiene en Tigo-UNE? esto opinan los expertos ](/colombia/medellin/le-conviene-a-medellin-la-venta-de-las-acciones-que-epm-tiene-en-tigo-une-esto-opinan-los-expertos-3364643) [ Tiroteo en asilo de ancianos en Croacia: la madre del presunto asesino vivía en la residencia; hay al menos 5 muertos ](/mundo/al-menos-cinco-muertos-en-tiroteo-en-un-asilo-croata-de-ancianos-3364393) Las autoridades informaron que otras 5 personas están heridas. Por lo pronto, se desconocen los motivos del ataque. [ El primer ministro israelí, Benjamín Netanyahu, viaja a Washington bajo presión para firmar un acuerdo de tregua con Hamás ](/mundo/medio-oriente/el-primer-ministro-israeli-benjamin-netanyahu-viaja-a-washington-bajo-presion-para-firmar-un-acuerdo-de-tregua-con-hamas-3364208) El primer ministro israelí viajará a Washington el lunes para reunirse con el presidente Joe Biden, mientras enfrenta presiones para firmar un acuerdo de tregua con Hamás antes de su partida. author: @Lille_actu
title: La Catho de Lille recrute des acteurs (aussi amateurs) pour un spectacle grandiose !
text:
Pour célébrer ses 150 ans, l’Université Catholique de Lille lance un projet artistique inédit. Un spectacle vivant et immersif réunira plus de 250 artistes, techniciens et bénévoles les 9, 10 et 11 octobre 2025. Théâtre, danse, effets spéciaux et projections géantes sont prévus. Pour cet événement, des bénévoles sont recherchés , avec à la clé des rencontres exceptionnelles avec des pros, notamment du Puy du Fou, et un danseur de Danse avec les stars !
À lire aussi
À Lille, quatre établissements fusionnent pour créer un nouvel ensemble scolaire catholique Trois soirées en octobre Pendant 3 soirées exceptionnelles les 9, 10 et 11 octobre, la scène de l’Aula Maxima se transformera en un immense plateau de cinéma vivant, traversant 150 ans d’Histoire en musique et en lumière.
Est lancé un appel aux participants pour devenir acteurs de ce spectacle hors du commun : tout le monde peut en faire partie, aucune expérience artistique n’est requise , et c’est 100% gratuit , sans aucune contrainte de lieu de résidence.
Avec des pros dont des artistes du Puy du Fou Tous les participants bénéficieront d’un accompagnement encadré par des professionnels du spectacle vivant. Des masterclass exclusives seront animées par des artistes du Puy du Fou, au cours desquelles seront partagés les techniques de chute, les déplacements scéniques, le jeu d’époque, la diction, le travail de la présence sur scène.
Des rencontres avec des metteurs en scène, techniciens et chorégraphes permettront de découvrir les coulisses du métier et les secrets de fabrication d’un spectacle vivant.
Vidéos : en ce moment sur Actu À lire aussi
Lille. Que se passe-t-il à l’Université catholique une fois les examens finis ? Plongez dans les coulisses ! Avec un danseur de Danse avec les Stars ! Les participants apprendront également à maîtriser effets spéciaux, jeux d’ombre et de lumière, synchronisation des mouvements… En remerciement, une masterclass sera offerte avec Samuel Texier, danseur professionnel révélé dans Danse avec les Star s .
Les représentations publiques ont lieu les 9, 10 et 11 octobre 2025. À cela s’ajoutent 2 demi-journées de répétitions en septembre (au choix selon vos dispos / week-end) et une répétition générale dimanche 5 octobre 2025.
Contact :  ; Suivez toute l’actualité de vos villes et médias favoris en vous inscrivant à Mon Actu .
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment
